name: Babel
description: The compiler for next generation JavaScript

name: Grafana
description: Grafana has evolved into a widely adopted tool in the observability and monitoring space

name: Let's Encrypt
description: Let's Encrypt is a non-profit certificate authority run by Internet Security Research Group (ISRG) that provides X.509 certificates for Transport Layer Security (TLS) encryption at no charge. Go to version for us right now

name: OWASP Dependency-Check
description: We need to assess possible tools. Clients start to demand this.

name: OWASP ASVS
description: We need to assess possible tools. Clients start to demand this.

name: Terraform
description: Terraform is an infrastructure as code tool that enables you to safely and predictably provision and manage infrastructure in any cloud. It's a common industry standard and we are leveraging it in several projects.

name: Terragrunt
description: Orchestration tool for Terraform. Enhances Terraform in a way which helps us to be more efficient with our templates.

name: ArgoCD
description: Gitops based approach to automatically deploy our apps into Kubernetes. We started to use this with one of our clients are are so far happy with it.

name: Webpack
description: Webpack is a module bundler. Its main purpose is to bundle JavaScript files for usage in a browser, yet it is also capable of transforming, bundling, or packaging just about any resource or asset.

name: Vite
description: Vite (French word for "quick", pronounced /vit/, like "veet") is a new breed of frontend build tooling that significantly improves the frontend development experience. A possible better alternative for Webpack.

name: axios
description: Axios is a promise-based HTTP Client for node.js and the browser. It's a new common library being used in the industry.

name: Jenkins as a deployment pipeline
description: We want to move away from Jenkins. Any existing Pipelines will be maintained but new pipelines will be done with Gitlab

name: Renovate
description: Automation to keep our dependencies up to date. We started to use it for a variety of repositories.

name: Gitlab CI Pipelines
description: Our current go to tool for building and running pipelines. It works well for us and has plenty of features if hosted as the open source version

name: React.js
description: Widely adopted frontend framework especially in the enterprise business. Also our favorite choice for new implementations especially in the enterprise business.

name: Redux
description: Global state handling for React based applications, widely adopted and safe to use.

name: React Remix/Router
description: Our favorite choice in combination with a react frontend. The fullstack approach is widely adopted and for us the primary choice for enterprise clients.

name: React Next
description: "Has quite some limitiations with regards to it's usage and compatibility with industry standards. Therefore we are not preferring this technology."

name: Vue.js
description: We have good experience with Vue and it's widely adopted nowadays. It's a bit less adopted in comparison to React and it's also more commonly used in the public sector.

name: Vue Nuxt
description: We are starting to gain experience with Vue Nuxt and have a strong beleive that this is a solid choice for us if the frontend choice favors Vue for whatever reason.

name: Spring Boot
description: Might help is with certain industries/clients. We will carefully observe this but would usually favor Quarkus over Spring Boot as Quarkus is build to be cloud native and has a more modern approach.

name: Quarkus
description: Modern alternative to Spring Boot, doesn't carry the old baggage of sprint. Cloud native. We are going into an assessment phase.

name: GraphQL
description: We support this but want to be careful with considering this as an option for green field projects with freedom of choice. It can be benificial in the right context but is often used in the wrong context.

name: gRPC
description: We support this but want to be careful with considering this as an option for green field projects with freedom of choice. gRPC has it's benefits within the right context but also brings complexity. Careful assessment is required.

name: Docker
description: Go to solution to containerize our applications

name: Kubernetes
description: Open Source container orchestration plattform we use in different distributions from vanilla to Rancher and AWS-EKS.

name: Rancher
description: Rancher, the open-source multi-cluster orchestration platform, lets operations teams deploy, manage and secure enterprise Kubernetes. We are using it for certain projects

name: Helm
description: ​Helm is an open-source package manager designed for Kubernetes, the widely used container orchestration platform. It streamlines the process of defining, installing, and managing applications within Kubernetes clusters by utilizing a packaging format known as Charts

name: .NET Core
description: Might help is with certain industries/clients, right now we are committing to this technology as it's usually rooted with clients who are heavily bought into the MS ecosystem. We still consider this as worth of an assessment if the right project happens to pop up.

name: Consumer-driven contract testing
description: We might want to assess this with one of our future clients/projects

name: Lightweight Architecture Decision Records
description: We have adopted this for all our Dev Chapters. We also started using it for our larger enterprise grade clients and will continue to use this.

name: Reactive architectures
description: Need a matching project to go into a trial phase

name: Serverless architecture
description: Need a matching project to go into a trial phase

name: Container security scanning
description: Automatically check containerised software for security vulnerabilities

name: Micro frontends
description: Would like to assess this within a matching project.

name: Rust
description: New go to backend language for faster and more efficient and secure Backends. Clients might not be willing to invest into it yet but there are use cases in which we would pitch Rust over any other language. It's overall a very trending and promising language so we stay invested.

name: PHP
description: We don't actively use PHP anymore. It has nearly no market share within our verticals. We are still using it as part of our tools but any net new development e.g. an API should not be done with PHP

name: Laravel
description: Go to PHP Framework for us

name: Symfony
description: We prefer using Symfony for new projects.

name: Axum
description: Rust Web framework

name: Redis
description: Go to technology to cache data

name: MariaDB
description: Replacement for MySQL

name: MySQL
description: Use MariaDB instead

name: Postgres
description: Favorite choice with regards to DB

name: ArangoDB
description: Had to use this within one of our projects and we don't see this fitting our usual requirements and overall direction

name: MSSQL
description: We don't want to actively use this anymore

name: DDev
description: Go to tool to handle our PHP based projects/dev environments

name: Cargo
description: Our preferred Rust package manager

name: Taskfiles
description: Our default approach to automate local development environment (setup/build...)

name: Atlas Router
description: We want to opensource this

name: contentful rs
description: We want to opensource this. This library is an abstraction layer to access contentful with a Rust

name: Python
description: We don't want to focus on this for net new development. We are open to use this if needed.

name: Golang
description: We don't want to focus on this for net new development. We are open to use this if needed.

name: RabbitMQ
description: We would like to try this within the context of matching project

name: Kafka

name: AWS SQS
description: Want to assess this for futurue opportunities

name: AWS SNS
description: Want to assess this for futurue opportunities

name: Storybook

name: Typescript

name: Angular
description: We don't want to focus on this.

name: Grafana Loki
description: We would like to assess this

description: We would like to assess this

name: Ansible
description: Industry standard and go to tooling in many scenarios

name: Cog
description: general purpose UI prototyping

name: Cypress
description: A very solid choice for test automation. We offer this but would not favor it if we have free choice. Playwright is our favored test automation tool

name: QA Audits
description: We would like to make this one of our offerings

name: Testing as a service
description: We would like to make this one of our offerings

name: Playwright
description: Our standard approach/offering for test automation. It has more benefits in comparison to Cypress and therefore is our favorite choice.

name: ElasticSearch
description: Need a more detailed trial

name: DORA
description: Dora Metrics to measure our effectiveness

name: AAF
description: Establishing an Architecture Advisory Forum to increase adoption rate across our chapters

name: DDD
description: Domain Driven Design as a consulting service for projects

description: C4 Documentation as the new standard for our bigger projects

name: Arc42
description: We would like to assess this

description: One of our new standards for a cleaner and automated version management of our code bases

name: Conventional Commits
description: One of our new standards for a cleaner and automated version management of our code bases

name: Markdown
description: Go to documentation format for our engineers

name: Github Copilot
description: Scale out for effective trial across engineers

name: TDD
description: We want to make this a bigger habbit for us and our projects

name: Mermaid
description: More trial in projects needed

name: AsciiDoc
description: More trial in projects needed

name: Trivy
description: Trial started for one of our bigger projects

name: SonarQube
description: We want to give this a more thorough try with regards to code complexity, technical debt and security analysis

name: Gen AI (ChatGPT, Claude)
description: Using it in small scale/small context. Github Copilot adoption started.

name: Solr
description: We are using this since a couple of years

name: Typo3
description: Currently our first choice for the majority of small to medium businesses as well es government implementations. It has certain limitations with regards to a modern CMS. This includes downsides with regards to usage as a headless CMS and more complicated approach to have it scalable

name: Shopware
description: One of our main offerings with regards to shop systems. It's widely adopted and has many benefits for small, medium and big clients. The plugin store offers more extensions and also allows us to sell our own plugins. Shopware is build for customization and therefore a better choice for an agency use case.

name: AWS
description: We are using AWS and various services for more than one of our projects

name: Xray
description: A test management tool integrated with Jira for planning, executing, and reporting on test cases

name: ISTQB Tester
description: Certification providing foundational knowledge in software testing principles and processes

name: ISTQB Test Management
description: Focuses on strategic planning and oversight of software testing activities

name: ISTQB Test Analyst
description: Certification covering test design, execution, and reporting based on system requirements

name: ISO 29119 Testing
description: A standardized approach to software testing processes and documentation

name: ISO 27001 IT Security
description: A framework for managing information security risks systematically

name: ISO 25010 System and software quality models
description: Defines quality characteristics like usability, reliability, and maintainability in software

name: Penetration Testing
description: Security testing to identify and exploit vulnerabilities in systems

name: Performance Testing
description: Assessing a system’s responsiveness, stability, and scalability under varying workloads

name: Use Case Testing
description: Validates system behavior by executing real-world scenarios

name: Explorative Testing
description: An informal, dynamic approach where testers actively explore the software to find defects

name: Checklist based Testing
description: Using pre-defined checklists to systematically verify system functionality

name: Javascript
description: A versatile programming language primarily used for interactive web development

name: Tailwind.css
description: A utility-first CSS framework for building custom designs efficiently

name: Alpine.js
description: A lightweight JavaScript framework for adding interactivity to HTML

name: Livewire
description: A Laravel framework for building reactive, dynamic web applications with minimal JavaScript

name: Filament
description: A framework for creating admin dashboards and management panels in Laravel

name: CSS
description: A style sheet language used to design the layout and appearance of HTML elements

name: SCSS
description: A CSS preprocessor adding variables, nested rules, and functions for maintainable styles

name: ChakraUI
description: A component library for React, offering accessible and customizable UI elements

name: Prisma ORM
description: A modern ORM for Node.js and TypeScript that simplifies database management

name: Quasar
description: A Vue.js framework for building responsive, high-performance web and mobile applications

name: Git
description: A version control system for tracking code changes and collaborating in software projects

name: Apache
description: A widely used open-source web server software

name: Nginx
description: A high-performance web server and reverse proxy, often used for load balancing

name: Phing
description: A PHP build tool based on Apache Ant for automating development workflows

name: Opencart
description: "Might be an alternative to Shopware
column6: definitely worth to assess and try this if sales acquires a client who wants to use opencart instead of Shopware"

name: Contentful
description: "We started using it for some of our projects. It has benefits especially for enterprise use cases and it's headless. It has a higher price point in comparison to Strapi and we still need to evaluate if Strapi is a better alternative"

name: Strapi
description: "We consider this as an alternative to Contentful. A more detailed assessment will be part of new projects which we will be working on"

name: Builder.io
description: "A solid website builder. We need to more closely assess this."

name: Webflow
description: "Failed during our trial stage
column6: it has a questionable pricing model and bad developer experience."

name: NodeJS
description: Solid foundation for all verticals. It's a popular choice and the foundation for the majority of BFFs.

name: Java
description: High in demand especially in the enterprise business. It's widely in use in our core markets. The language continously evolved and has one of the best open source communities and library support in the market

name: Astro
description: Very modern framework approach for content driven sites. We will assess this more closely to extend our headless CMS experience
